nodes.label: Towards Believable Acting
nodes.description: A research paper on creating believable AI-driven character acting using reinforcement learning and procedural animation systems.

nodes.label: Reinforcement Learning
nodes.description: Machine learning technique where agents learn optimal actions through trial and error interactions with an environment.

nodes.label: Procedural Animation
nodes.description: Automated generation of character movements and gestures using algorithms rather than hand-crafted animations.

nodes.label: Vectors & Matrices
nodes.description: Mathematical structures for representing positions, directions, and transformations in space.

nodes.label: Matrix Multiplication
nodes.description: Mathematical operation for chaining rotations, translations, and scalings in computer graphics and animation.

nodes.label: Eigenvalues & Eigenvectors
nodes.description: Advanced mathematical concepts used for deformation and smoothing in procedural animation systems.

nodes.label: Attention Is All You Need
nodes.description: Introduces the Transformer architecture based entirely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions. This paper revolutionized natural language processing and became the foundation for modern large language models.

nodes.label: Neural Networks
nodes.description: Computational models inspired by biological neural networks, consisting of interconnected nodes that process information.

nodes.label: Backpropagation
nodes.description: Algorithm for training neural networks by calculating gradients and updating weights through reverse differentiation.

nodes.label: Sequence-to-Sequence Models
nodes.description: Neural architectures that transform input sequences into output sequences, commonly used in translation and text generation.

nodes.label: Attention Mechanisms
nodes.description: Techniques that allow models to focus on relevant parts of input when making predictions.

nodes.label: Recurrent Neural Networks
nodes.description: Neural networks with loops that allow information to persist, designed for sequential data processing.

nodes.label: Encoder-Decoder Architecture
nodes.description: Neural network design pattern where an encoder processes input and a decoder generates output.

nodes.label: Multi-Head Attention
nodes.description: Extension of attention mechanism that allows the model to jointly attend to information from different representation subspaces.

nodes.label: Positional Encoding
nodes.description: Technique to inject information about position of tokens in a sequence since transformers have no inherent notion of order.

nodes.label: Linear Algebra
nodes.description: Mathematical foundation involving vectors, matrices, and linear transformations essential for understanding neural networks.

nodes.label: Calculus
nodes.description: Mathematical field studying rates of change and accumulation, fundamental for understanding backpropagation.

nodes.label: Probability Theory
nodes.description: Mathematical framework for reasoning about uncertainty and randomness in machine learning.

nodes.label: O3 System Card
nodes.description: System card describing OpenAI's O3 model, including capabilities, safety evaluations, and deployment considerations. Represents advancement in reasoning capabilities and AI safety measures.

nodes.label: Large Language Models
nodes.description: Advanced neural language models with billions of parameters capable of complex language understanding and generation.

nodes.label: Transformer Architecture
nodes.description: Neural network architecture based on attention mechanisms that underlies modern LLMs.

nodes.label: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback
nodes.description: Training technique that uses human preferences to align AI systems with human values.

nodes.label: AI Safety
nodes.description: Field focused on ensuring AI systems behave safely and beneficially.

nodes.label: Constitutional AI
nodes.description: Method for training AI systems to follow a set of principles or constitution.

nodes.label: Reasoning and Planning
nodes.description: Cognitive capabilities for multi-step problem solving and strategic thinking.

nodes.label: Evaluation Methodologies
nodes.description: Systematic approaches for assessing AI model performance and capabilities.

nodes.label: Alignment Research
nodes.description: Research focused on ensuring AI systems pursue intended goals and behave as desired.

nodes.label: Model Interpretability
nodes.description: Techniques for understanding and explaining how AI models make decisions.

nodes.label: Scaling Laws
nodes.description: Empirical relationships between model size, compute, and performance in AI systems.

nodes.label: Machine Learning
nodes.description: Fundamental algorithms and techniques for learning from data.

nodes.label: Ethics
nodes.description: Moral principles and values that guide responsible AI development.

nodes.label: A Critical Review of Recurrent Neural Networks for Sequence Learning
nodes.description: Comprehensive survey of recurrent neural networks, covering fundamentals, architectures like LSTM and GRU, training challenges, and applications in sequence learning tasks.

nodes.label: Sequence Modeling
nodes.description: Techniques for processing and predicting sequential data like time series or text.

nodes.label: Gradient Descent
nodes.description: Optimization algorithm for training neural networks by minimizing loss functions.

nodes.label: LSTM Networks
nodes.description: Long Short-Term Memory networks designed to solve vanishing gradient problems in RNNs.

nodes.label: GRU Networks
nodes.description: Gated Recurrent Unit networks, a simplified variant of LSTM.

nodes.label: Vanishing Gradient Problem
nodes.description: Challenge in training deep networks where gradients become exponentially small in earlier layers.

nodes.label: Backpropagation Through Time
nodes.description: Extension of backpropagation algorithm for training recurrent neural networks.

nodes.label: Gating Mechanisms
nodes.description: Control structures in neural networks that regulate information flow.

nodes.label: Time Series Analysis
nodes.description: Statistical methods for analyzing temporal data and identifying patterns.

nodes.label: Natural Language Processing
nodes.description: Field of AI focused on enabling computers to understand and process human language.

nodes.label: Optimization Theory
nodes.description: Mathematical framework for finding optimal solutions to problems.

nodes.label: Computational Complexity
nodes.description: Study of computational resources required to solve problems.

nodes.label: Fundamentals of RNN and LSTM
nodes.description: Mathematical tutorial on RNN and LSTM derivations from differential equations.

nodes.label: Differential Equations
nodes.description: Mathematical models for dynamic systems.

nodes.label: Playing Atari with Deep Reinforcement Learning
nodes.description: Introduces Deep Q-Networks (DQN), combining Q-learning with deep neural networks to achieve human-level performance on Atari games.

nodes.label: Q-Learning
nodes.description: Model-free reinforcement learning algorithm for learning optimal actions.

nodes.label: Convolutional Neural Networks
nodes.description: Neural networks specialized for processing grid-like data such as images.

nodes.label: Experience Replay
nodes.description: Technique for storing and reusing past experiences to improve learning stability.

nodes.label: Target Networks
nodes.description: Separate networks used to compute target values for stable training.

nodes.label: Markov Decision Processes
nodes.description: Mathematical framework for modeling decision making problems.

nodes.label: Function Approximation
nodes.description: Using neural networks to approximate value functions in large state spaces.

nodes.label: Bellman Equations
nodes.description: Recursive equations that express optimal value functions.

nodes.label: Temporal Difference Learning
nodes.description: Learning method that updates estimates based on other estimates.

nodes.label: Epsilon-Greedy Strategy
nodes.description: Exploration strategy that balances exploitation and exploration.

nodes.label: Computer Vision
nodes.description: Processing and understanding visual information from images.
